roleset.name: bring or bringing down (in mood or activity), blue, feeling down, sad

example.name: ARG2
example.text: the American parks depressed him with their squalor, their lack of organization, haphazard and tiring acres of concrete, their surly personnel.
example.arg: with their squalor, their lack of organization, haphazard and tiring acres of concrete, their surly personnel.

example.name: depression-n: with causer (kind of awkward)
example.text: The bad news' depression of the entire team was to blame for their poor game performance.

example.name: depression-n: make less active
example.text: the economic depression of the previous decade

example.name: depressing-j
example.text: Yeah but you re so depressing Haha . you re like i work sleep do studies& work and sleep & do studies Haha .

example.name: depressed-j: args 0, 1
example.text: I am depressed about my life and not being able to work..:
example.arg: about my life and not being able to work..:

roleset.note: DEPRESS-V NOTES: Do try to distinguish between agents and instruments, as this makes adifference for the so-called 'psych' verbs (of which this is one). (from depress.01-v)
DEPRESSION-N NOTES: Based on frame for depress-v.01. Framed by Anwen March 2011 (from depression.01-n)
DEPRESSING-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from depressing.01-j)
DEPRESSED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, depress-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls ammuse-31.1. (from depressed.01-j)

roleset.name: bring down (stock prices)

example.name: depress-v: it was inevitable
example.text: However, the executive noted that slackening demand for new mortgages depressed new loan originations to $1 billion, 30% below the same period last year.
example.arg: to $1 billion, 30% below the same period last year.

example.name: depress-v: passive
example.text: [London shares]-1 were depressed *trace*-1 initially by overnight losses in New York.
example.arg: by overnight losses in New York.

example.name: depress-v: active
example.text: The industry's chemical profits also declined because excess capacity has depressed prices.

roleset.note: DEPRESS-V NOTES: Frames file for 'depress' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 31.1, other framed members include comfort, convince encourage, interest, reassure, repel, scare, shock, spook, threaten and worry. Comparison with, gee, pick one. (from depress.02-v predicate notes)
